data.title: Spanish
data.meta_description: Take the Advanced Credit Exams to get your perfect placement in the Spanish program based on your experience with the language.
data.text:
Admissions Requirements

To major in Spanish and Hispanic studies, you must meet the University's admissions requirements.

See the full admission requirements.

Graduation Requirements

You will be required to maintain a grade of “C” or better in each major Spanish course and a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or better to graduate.

You will need to earn an 18-hour minor of your choosing.

You are also required to have an exit interview during your last semester. This is an ungraded, informal discussion used for assessment of the program. It is mandatory but does not affect your record in any way.

View the full major requirements for Spanish and Hispanic studies.

You must take the Advanced Credit Exam at the beginning of your studies in Spanish at the University.

Taking the exam will help the department place you in the right course for your level. When you complete your first course after taking the exam, you will receive official credit for the previous Spanish courses.

More about Advanced Credit Exams

To complete a minor in Spanish, you will need to complete 18 credits hours of Spanish courses, with a minimum of 6 credit hours at the 300 or 400 levels.

SPAN 101 does not count toward the Spanish minor.

If you take Spanish to fulfill a language requirement, you can complete the minor with only three additional courses. Enhance your cultural experience of Lafayette and the surrounding area by minoring in Spanish.

View the full minor requirements.
